snippet: The State Department is releasing the emails in batches, subject to a court order after revelations that Mrs. Clinton had used a private email system while she was the secretary of state.
abstract: State Dept review of 6,300 of Hillary Rodham Clinton's emails during her time as secretary of state is made public; reveals three emails sent to her contained information that should have been classified as 'secret'; five of emails analyzed appear to have been part of efforts by hackers to infiltrate Clinton's personal email system; Clinton's State Dept emails have been recurrent issue in presidential campaign.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Peter Baker, David E. Sanger and Eric Lipton contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The State Department is releasing the emails in batches, subject to a court order after revelations that Mrs. Clinton had used a private email system while she was the secretary of state.

headline.main: 3 Hillary Clinton Emails Deemed ‘Secret’ in State Dept. Review of 6,300 Pages
headline.print_headline: State Dept. Calls 3 Clinton Emails ‘Secret’ After Reviewing 6,300 Pages
